result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark A Washington was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $350.00 to Beer Capitol Distributing. Joint and several with Caleb Seay-Ali  14CF615.   Failure to pay by end of Extended supervision will result in a civil judgment.

Pay court costs, surcharges and restitution. To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of fundsunder Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms or body armor; and he may not vote until his civil rights are restored.

records.addlTxt:
Order concerning sentence adjustment, filed and distributed. 
The petition for sentence adjustmen is denied because it is not in the public interest.
Copy mailed.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Wagner, Br. 38, for review. mag

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript SENTENCING HEARING  (25 pages) commencing JULY 1, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Mark A Washington in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Defendant Mark A Washington in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections were made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by: Pamela C.

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 141 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The Court finds the defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, but NOT the Substance Abuse Program.

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay restitution of $350.00 to Beer Capitol Distributing, joint and several with Caleb Seay-Ali, Case# 14CF615.  Failure to pay by the end of extended supervision will result in civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms or body armour, and he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed:
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Letters in support of the defendant received and filed.
Presentence report from Department of Corrections received and filed.  Defense Attorney and Assistant District Attorney notified.
Due to calendar conflict and without objection by the state (ADA Mark Williams), defense counsel, Atty Pecora, is requesting that the sentencing be adjourned to 7-1-2014 at 8:15am.

To the AMENDED Information:   Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Court will enter restitution at $350.00 payable to Beer Capitol Distributing, joint and several with Caleb Seay-Ali in 14CF615.
Court orders PSI without recommendation.  Case is adjourned to 6-24-2014 at 8:15am for sentencing.  Defendant remanded.

Defendant Mark A Washington in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Defendant Mark A Washington in custody.  Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Amended Information filed by the state:  Attempt Armed Robbery, PTAC, 943.32(1)(a) and (2), 939.32, 939.05, a class C felony.
Request from Atty Pecora requesting additional time to file motions, beyond date of 4-21-2014 due to outstanding discovery issues.
Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED.  Cash bail to remain at $50,000.00

Attorney Mark Pecora in court, defendant Mark A Washington not in court, in custody.  Mark S. Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for final pretrial on 5-23-2014 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-16-2014 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 4-21-2014.   Evidentiary motions to be heard on final pretrial date.
Court issues an oral KEEP SEPERATE ORDER with co-defendant, Caleb Seay-Ali.

Defendant Mark A Washington in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Defendant Mark A Washington in custody.  Grant Huebner for Mark S Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38 due to co-defendant's lower pending case.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Filed Substitution is withdrawn.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mark A Washington in court with attorney Mark Pecora.  Defendant Mark A Washington in custody.  Carole R Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
